FacilityName: Linn Cooperative Oil Co.  Springville Plant
ParentCompanyName: Linn Cooperative Oil Co.  Marion, Iowa
SafetyInspectionBy: Iowa Dept.of Agriculture and Land Stewardship

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:
 This facility complies with OSHA (29 CFR 1910.111) requirements for Anhydrous Ammonia storage
and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws. If an emergency were to
occur, it is our policy to notify the Springville Fire Dept. and the Linn Co. LEPC, and request that they
respond to our emergency.

Facility desciption and regulated substance handled:
 This facility is an NH3 plant. We sell and apply Anhydrous Ammonia as farm fertilizer. Our NH3 
plant consists of one storage tank (18,000 gal.) and associated piping, compressor pump, valves,
vents, nurse tanks and other miscellaneous equipment.

Worst Case release scenario:
 Our worst case scenario is a sudden failure of the storage tank when filled to maximum allowed
(SOP 85% full), resulting in a toxic gas cloud. According to EPA look-up tables, the distance to the 
endpoint is 3.3 miles. Within that distance to the endpoint are private residences, schools, recreation
areas, and some small businesses, including farms. Population within the endpoint is 1,195 .

Alternative release scenario:
 A more likely scenario would be a transfer hose failure, resulting in a small toxic gas cloud.
According to EPA look-up tables, the distance to the endpoint is 0.5 mile.
Within that distance are private residences, a school, recreation areas, and some small businesses,
including farms. Population within the endpoint is 161.

General accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps:
 This facility complies with the EPA's accident prevention rule, as well as all applicable local and
state codes and regulations. This Anhydrous Ammonia plant is designed, built and maintained according
to OSHA (29 CFR 1910.111) and state regulations.

Five-year accident history:
 No accidents involving NH3 that caused death, injuries, evacuations, environmental or property damage.

Planned changes to improve Safety : None at thi

s time


Emergency Response program:
 It is our policy that in the event of an emergency involving NH3, the Springville Fire Dept. and the Linn
Co. LEPC be notified of, and requested to respond to the emergency. We have discussed this with
the Fire Dept. and the LEPC. The Fire Dept. has a copy of our Emergency Action Plan and also inspects
the facility on a yearly basis.  The county LEPC was briefed on NH3 operations and procedures during
their February 2001 meeting by Linn Cooperative Oil Co.
